result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samuel Vicellordae Johnson

defendant.name: Johnson, Samuel Vicellordae

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in court with attorney David Saldana.  Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in custody.  Erika Frank Motsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.
Parties have reached a resolution. Upon plea to 15CF1674, 15CF1670 is DRI. The State agrees to dismiss the CT matter. The CT is not consolidated in this branch and will be dismissed outright by the Court. The State recommends 5 yrs WPS bifurcated as 2 1/2 yrs IC, 2 1/2 yrs ES.
P- COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered

Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in court with attorney David Saldana.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Rose Coulthart.
Defense motion for bond review.  Mother Dorothy Earl and girlfriend Lynnette Famous   are present in courtroom and both are willing to co-sign.  Defendant willing to attend daily self-help meetings.
State opposes modification due to nature of offenses.  Defendant has also violated previous bonds.  Per defense, violations were due to use of controlled substances, not missing court.  
Defense will be asking for adjournment of JT.  Speedy trial demand will be withdrawn.  
BTC:  motion denied; bond will remain as set.
Court colloquy with defendant re withdrawal of speedy trial demand.  Defendant withdraws his speedy trial demand.
Motion to adjourn trial granted.
for reduction of bail, filed by Atty Saldana.

Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in custody.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Defense req bond mod in 15CF1670 and 15CF1674.
State objects. 
BTC:  Bond mod denied.
Defense enters DST.
BTC:  DST will be on 15CF1674.
  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for April 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in court with attorney Laura Ann Walker.  Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, JMW. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in court with attorney Jillian Jean Scheidegger.  Defendant Samuel Vicellordae Johnson in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
